intro: Corydalis swatensis, commonly known as the Swat Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Pakistan. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant produces small, elongated seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
